    Used to add information to the Database

      • classCreate

        public static boolean classCreate(java.lang.String ApplicationRoot,
                  java.lang.String className,
                  java.lang.String classYear)
        Database procedure just adds this. So this method just prepares the statement
        Parameters:
        ApplicationRoot -
        className - Class name
        classYear - Year of the class in YY/YY. eg 11/12
        Returns:

      • closeAllModules

        public static boolean closeAllModules(java.lang.String ApplicationRoot)
        This method sets every module status to Closed.
        Parameters:
        ApplicationRoot - Current running director of the application
        moduleId - The identifier of the module that is being set to open status
        Returns:
        Boolean result depicting success of statement

      • createModule

        public static java.lang.String createModule(java.lang.String applicationRoot,
                            java.lang.String challengeName,
                            java.lang.String challengeType,
                            java.lang.String challengeCategory,
                            java.lang.String challengeSolution,
                            boolean isUserSpecificKey)
        Used to create a new module entry in the core database. The database will handle creating the new module identifier and module hash. The module has will be returned form the database, and if it does not start will a letter, the application will update the database to reflect a hash starting with a letter, without sacrificing the uniqueness of the hash
        Parameters:
        applicationRoot - The current running context of the application
        challengeName - The name of the module to create
        challengeType - The type of module to create
        challengeCategory - The category of the new challenge
        challengeSolution - The solution of the new challenge
        isUserSpecificKey - Is the Key for this level a user specific key or is it hard coded
        Returns:
        The new module identifier

      • createVulnerableSchema

        public static java.lang.String createVulnerableSchema(java.sql.Connection conn,
                                      java.lang.String challengeName,
                                      java.lang.String tableName,
                                      java.lang.String[] attrib,
                                      int attribAmount)
                                               throws java.sql.SQLException
        Used by the challenge builder to create a new schema on the vulnerable database server.
        Parameters:
        conn - Connection to the vulnerable database server
        challengeName - The name of the challenge been created by the builder
        tableName - The name of the table to create in the vulnerable schema
        attrib - An array of attributes to use when creating the schema's table
        attribAmount - The amount of attributes been created in the table
        Returns:
        The new schema's name if successful
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Throws this exception if there is an error creating the vulnerable schema

      • incrementBadSubmission

        public static boolean incrementBadSubmission(java.lang.String ApplicationRoot,
                             java.lang.String userId)
        Used to increment bad submission counter in DB. DB will handle point deductions once the counter hits 40
        Parameters:
        ApplicationRoot - application running context
        userId - user identifier to increment
        Returns:
        False if the statement fails to execute

        public static boolean openAllModules(java.lang.String ApplicationRoot)
        This method sets every module status to Open.
        Parameters:
        ApplicationRoot - Current running director of the application
        moduleId - The identifier of the module that is being set to open status
        Returns:
        Boolean result depicting success of statement

      • openOnlyMobileCategories

        Parameters:
        ApplicationRoot - Used to locate database properties file
        Returns:

        public static boolean openOnlyWebCategories(java.lang.String ApplicationRoot)
        This is used to only open Mobile category levels
        Parameters:
        ApplicationRoot - Used to locate database properties file
        Returns:

      • populateVulnerableSchema

        public static void populateVulnerableSchema(java.sql.Connection conn,
                            java.lang.String schemaName,
                            java.lang.String theTable,
                            java.lang.String[] data,
                            java.lang.String[] attrib,
                            int attribAmount)
                                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        Used to populate the vulnerable schemas table with an array of attributes. This method adds ONE row to a table
        Parameters:
        conn - Connection to the vulnerable database server
        schemaName - The name of the schema in the vulnerable database server
        theTable - The name of the table to populate
        data - The data to use for population
        attrib - The list of attributes to be populated
        attribAmount - The amount of attributes been populated
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Thrown if there is a population error

      • resetBadSubmission

        public static boolean resetBadSubmission(java.lang.String ApplicationRoot,
                         java.lang.String userId)
        Resets user bad submission counter to 0
        Parameters:
        ApplicationRoot - Application's running context
        userId - User Identifier to reset
        Returns:

      • setCoreDatabaseInfo

        public static boolean setCoreDatabaseInfo(java.lang.String applicationRoot,
                          java.lang.String url,
                          java.lang.String userName,
                          java.lang.String password)
        This method converts the default database properties file at applicationRoot/WEB-INF/site.properties
        Parameters:
        applicationRoot - The directory that the server is actually in
        url - The Url of the core Database
        userName - The user name of the database user
        password - The password of the database user
        Returns:
        Boolean value depicting the success of the method

      • setCsrfChallengeFourCsrfToken

        public static java.lang.String setCsrfChallengeFourCsrfToken(java.lang.String userId,
                                             java.lang.String csrfToken,
                                             java.lang.String ApplicationRoot)
        This method is used to store a CSRF Token for a specific user in the csrfChallengeSeven DB Schema. May not necessarily be a new CSRF token after running
        Parameters:
        userId - User Identifier
        csrfToken - CSRF Token to add to the csrfChallengeSix DB Schema
        ApplicationRoot - Running context of the application
        Returns:
        Returns current CSRF token for user for CSRF Ch4

      • setCsrfChallengeSevenCsrfToken

        public static boolean setCsrfChallengeSevenCsrfToken(java.lang.String userId,
                                     java.lang.String csrfToken,
                                     java.lang.String ApplicationRoot)
        This method is used to store a CSRF Token for a specific user in the csrfChallengeSix DB Schema
        Parameters:
        userId - User Identifier
        csrfToken - CSRF Token to add to the csrfChallengeSix DB Schema
        ApplicationRoot - Running context of the application
        Returns:

      • setExposedDatabaseInfo

        public static boolean setExposedDatabaseInfo(java.lang.String applicationRoot,
                             java.lang.String url,
                             java.lang.String userName,
                             java.lang.String password)
        This method converts the default database properties file at applicationRoot/WEB-INF/vulnerableDb.properties
        Parameters:
        applicationRoot - The directory that the server is actually in
        url - The Url of the exposed Database
        userName - The username of the database user
        password - The password of the database user
        Returns:
        Boolean value depicting the success of the method

      • setModuleCategoryStatusOpen

        public static boolean setModuleCategoryStatusOpen(java.lang.String ApplicationRoot,
                                  java.lang.String moduleCategory,
                                  java.lang.String openOrClosed)
        This method is used to set the status of all modules in a category to open or closed.
        Parameters:
        ApplicationRoot - Used to locate database properties file
        moduleCategory - The module category to open or closed
        openOrClosed - What to set the module status to. Can only be "open" or "closed"
        Returns:

      • setModuleStatusClosed

        public static boolean setModuleStatusClosed(java.lang.String ApplicationRoot,
                            java.lang.String moduleId)
        This method sets the module status to Closed. This information is absorbed by the Tournament Floor Plan
        Parameters:
        ApplicationRoot - Current running director of the application
        moduleId - The identifier of the module that is being set to closed status
        Returns:
        Boolean result depicting success of statement

      • setModuleStatusOpen

                          java.lang.String moduleId)

        Parameters:
        ApplicationRoot - Current running director of the application
        moduleId - The identifier of the module that is being set to open status
        Returns:
        Boolean result depicting success of statement

      • setStoredMessage

        public static boolean setStoredMessage(java.lang.String ApplicationRoot,
                       java.lang.String message,
                       java.lang.String userId,
                       java.lang.String moduleId)
        Used by CSRF levels to store their CSRF attack string, that will be displayed in a CSRF forum for the class the user is in
        Parameters:
        ApplicationRoot - The current running context of the application
        message - The String they want to store
        userId - The identifier of the user in which to store the attack under
        moduleId - The module identifier of which to store the message under
        Returns:
        A boolean value reflecting the success of the function

      • suspendUser

        public static boolean suspendUser(java.lang.String ApplicationRoot,
                  java.lang.String userId,
                  int numberOfMinutes)
        Sets user to suspended in the database for a specific amount of time. This prevents them from signing into the application
        Parameters:
        ApplicationRoot - Running context of application
        userId - User Identifier of the to be suspended user
        numberOfMinutes - Amount of minutes to suspend user
        Returns:
        Returns true if statement succeeds without fatal error

      • unSuspendUser

        public static boolean unSuspendUser(java.lang.String ApplicationRoot,
                    java.lang.String userId)
        Revokes a suspension that may have been applied to a user
        Parameters:
        ApplicationRoot - Running context of application
        userId - The Identifier of the user that will be released from suspension
        Returns:

      • updateCheatSheet

        public static boolean updateCheatSheet(java.lang.String applicationRoot,
                       java.lang.String moduleId,
                       java.lang.String newSolution)
        Used to update a module's cheat sheet
        Parameters:
        applicationRoot - The current running context of the application
        moduleId - The identifier of the module to update
        newSolution - The new cheat sheet content
        Returns:
        A boolean value reflecting the success of the operation

      • updateCsrfCounter

        public static boolean updateCsrfCounter(java.lang.String ApplicationRoot,
                        java.lang.String moduleId,
                        java.lang.String userId)
        Used to increment a users CSRF counter for CSRF levels.
        Parameters:
        ApplicationRoot - The current running context of the application.
        moduleId - The identifier of the module to increment the counter of
        userId - The user to be incremented
        Returns:
        Boolean reflecting the success of the operation

      • updatePassword

        public static boolean updatePassword(java.lang.String ApplicationRoot,
                     java.lang.String userName,
                     java.lang.String currentPassword,
                     java.lang.String newPassword)
        Parameters:
        ApplicationRoot - The current running context of the application
        userName - User name of the user
        currentPassword - User's current password
        newPassword - New password to use in update
        Returns:
        ResultSet that contains error details if not successful

                          java.lang.String userId,
                          java.lang.String newPassword)
        Updates a player's password without needing the current password
        Parameters:
        ApplicationRoot - Running context of the applicaiton
        userName - The username of the user to update
        newPassword - The new password to assign to the user
        Returns:

      • updatePlayerClass

        public static java.lang.String updatePlayerClass(java.lang.String ApplicationRoot,
                                 java.lang.String classId,
                                 java.lang.String playerId)
        Updates a PLAYER's class identifier
        Parameters:
        ApplicationRoot - The current running context of the application
        classId - New class to be assigned to
        playerId - Player to be assigned to new class
        Returns:
        The userName that was updated

      • updatePlayerClassToNull

        public static java.lang.String updatePlayerClassToNull(java.lang.String ApplicationRoot,
                                       java.lang.String playerId)
        Updates a PLAYER's class identifier to null
        Parameters:
        ApplicationRoot - The current running context of the application
        playerId - The identifier of the player to be assigned to class NULL
        Returns:
        The userName that was updated

      • updatePlayerResult

        public static java.lang.String updatePlayerResult(java.lang.String ApplicationRoot,
                                  java.lang.String moduleId,
                                  java.lang.String userId,
                                  java.lang.String extra,
                                  int before,
                                  int after,
                                  int difficulty)
        Updates a users result of a specific module
        Parameters:
        ApplicationRoot - The current running context of the application
        moduleId - Identifier of the module the user is completing
        userId - Identifier of the user completing the module
        extra - The additional comments submitted in feedback by the user, or if CSRF, the attack string they used
        before - The knowledge the user felt before they completed the level
        after - The knowledge the user felt after they completed the level
        difficulty - The difficulty the user felt they encountered
        Returns:
        The module name of the module completed by the user

      • updateUserPoints

        public static boolean updateUserPoints(java.lang.String ApplicationRoot,
                       java.lang.String userId,
                       int points)
        Adds or Subtracts points from a user.
        Parameters:
        ApplicationRoot - Running context of application
        userId - Identifier of user to update
        points - Positive or Negative number of points to update by
        Returns:
        Returns true if statement executes without fatal error

      • updateUserRole

        public static java.lang.String updateUserRole(java.lang.String ApplicationRoot,
                              java.lang.String playerId,
                              java.lang.String newRole)
        Updates a USER's role
        Parameters:
        ApplicationRoot - The current running context of the application
        playerId - The identifier of the player to update
        newRole - Must be "player" or "admin"
        Returns:
        The user name of the user updated

      • userCreate

        public static boolean userCreate(java.lang.String ApplicationRoot,
                 java.lang.String classId,
                 java.lang.String userName,
                 java.lang.String userPass,
                 java.lang.String userRole,
                 java.lang.String userAddress,
                 boolean tempPass)
                          throws java.sql.SQLException
        Used by many functions to create players or admins
        Parameters:
        ApplicationRoot -
        classId - Cannot be null, relationship depending
        userName - Cannot be null
        userPass - Cannot be null
        userRole - Cannot be null, must be "player" or "admin"
        userAddress - Must be unique
        tempPass - Whether or not to set the user with a temporary pass flag
        Returns:
        A boolean value determining the result of the creation
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If the creation fails, a Exception is thrown
